content.text:
# List of Indiana state historical markers in Starke County

__NOTOC__
This is a list of the Indiana state historical markers in Starke County.
This is intended to be a detailed table of the official state historical marker placed in Starke County, Indiana, United States by the Indiana Historical Bureau. The location of the historical marker and its latitude and longitude coordinates are included below when available, along with its name, year of placement, and topics as recorded by the Historical Bureau.  There is 1 historical marker located in Starke County.
Historical markers
{|class="wikitable sortable" style="width:98%"
! Marker title
! class="unsortable" | Image
! Year placed
! Location
! Topics
|-
|La Salle in Indiana
|
|2000
|In the parking lot for the Turkey Foot Conservation Area, south of U.S. Route 30 on County Road 50 E/N. Range Road, 0.6 miles east of the La Porte County line and the Kankakee River, near Davis Station and Hamlet
|Early Settlement and Exploration
|}
